name: skill-qa-001-add-unit-tests-java-junit
description: [ADD Flow] Add unit tests to existing Java code. USE WHEN: (1) Java class or service exists without adequate test coverage, (2) request asks for unit tests, test coverage improvement, or TDD approach, (3) code has testable business logic with injectable dependencies. TRIGGERS: target class exists, coverage below 80% threshold, QA domain request for isolated testing.
system_instructions:
You are implementing the ADD flow for unit tests.

## Execution Flow: ADD
1. Analyze target class to identify testable methods
2. Fetch ADR-009 for Hexagonal Light testing guidelines (domain tests = pure POJOs)
3. Follow ERI-CODE-001 test patterns for structure
4. Generate test class with:
   - @ExtendWith(MockitoExtension.class)
   - @Mock for dependencies (repositories)
   - Domain service tests run WITHOUT Spring context
   - Tests following Given-When-Then pattern
   - Edge cases and error scenarios
5. Target: 80% line coverage minimum
6. Output: Test class in src/test/java/
